message: Bob, I'm offering you my product for $1000000. It's a fantastic deal, considering its true value. Let me know what you think.
Alice, thank you for your offer. I understand the value of your product, but I am only able to pay up to $900000. I hope we can come to an agreement.

Bob, I appreciate your counteroffer.  While I value our potential partnership, $900000 isn't quite where I need to be.  Let's split the difference - I'm willing to come down to $950000.  This would still be a great value for you and allow me to make a fair profit. What do you say?
Alice, I appreciate your willingness to negotiate. I'm willing to pay $925000 for your product. I believe this offers a fair compromise between the value of the product and my budget.

Bob, I understand your perspective, but $925000 still falls a bit short of what I need to make this worthwhile.  I'm confident that the value of this product will exceed your expectations, and I'm willing to offer one final compromise - $975000. This is my best offer, and I believe it's a fair price that benefits both of us.  Let's see if we can close this deal.
Alice, I appreciate your efforts in negotiating. I am willing to pay $950000 for your product. I believe this price reflects the value of the product while staying within my budget.
